theoryTitle: Skypiea as a Microcosm of the Final War
theoryText: The Skypiea Arc serves as a microcosm and foreshadowing of the final war in One Piece. The conflict between the Shandia (original inhabitants fighting for their homeland), Sky Islanders (current inhabitants), and Enel (tyrannical god figure) mirrors the larger conflict between the Ancient Kingdom, World Government, and Celestial Dragons. The resolution in Skypiea - where Luffy defeats the 'god' and helps restore the land to its rightful people while uniting factions - foreshadows how the final war may conclude.
author: Various One Piece theorists
supportingEvidence: The Shandia's 400-year fight parallels the Void Century mystery
Enel's lightning powers and god complex parallel the Celestial Dragons
The Golden Bell parallel to Joy Boy's promise
Liberation imagery with drums and dancing (later seen in Nika/Gear 5)

theoryTitle: Nola's Emotional Intelligence and the Bell
theoryText: Nola's reaction to the Golden Bell suggests that ancient creatures in One Piece possess far greater emotional intelligence and memory than typical animals. The theory suggests that Nola has been waiting 400 years to hear the bell again because it represents the friendship with Noland and Kalgara. This could indicate that other ancient creatures (like the Sea Kings and Zunesha) also have deep emotional connections to historical events and may play crucial roles in the endgame.
author: One Piece Wiki contributors
supportingEvidence: Nola's emotional response to hearing the bell
The snake's 400-year lifespan and intact memories
Parallel to Sea Kings communicating with Roger and Oden
Zunesha's similar ancient lifespan and emotional connection to Joy Boy

theoryTitle: The Shandia's Inherited Will and D. Clan Connection
theoryText: The Shandia's unwavering 400-year commitment to reclaiming their homeland and protecting the Poneglyph mirrors the inherited will of the D. Clan. Some theorists suggest that the Shandia may have historical connections to the Ancient Kingdom, and their role as protectors of Shandora's Poneglyph wasn't coincidental but part of a larger responsibility passed down through generations, similar to how the D. Clan carries mysterious inherited will.
author: r/OnePiece community
supportingEvidence: Their role as protectors of the Poneglyph
Kalgara's promise to Noland paralleling inherited promises in the story
The theme of inherited will is central to One Piece
